formalText: A friend had asked whether we talked about hospitalization
We think James should come and go to the ER and  by the time we see each other again he hopefully will be feeling better enough.
Came in stating, "I'm  continuing to not do well, feeling pretty crappy"
he started deciding not to kill herself which he said takes a lot of work.
He becomes mad and
feels like he is less concerned about how other people are going to feel about the things he says than she usually is
He says he feels more abandoned.
In regards to his ideas of committing suicide, he is afraid of dying, but he thinks he is more afraid of just continuing to be like this.
He will start thinking "maybe this will just be over, like maybe I won't have to feel this way"
He states, "I'm a sick man.
I'm like the tissue box that will not die"
The main thing is that he is feeling quite a bit miserable and in a tremendous amount of emotional pain.
He has been thinking about committing the act by
just taking the car somewhere.
He is feeling a bunch of pressure to make a plan not to kill yourself and to stay alive this afternoon.
I told him that he could call me and can come in a little later and we'll talk some more and go from there.
James will come in probably 10 minutes.
self-hatred and fighting amongst herself
isn't  as much a thing anymore.
She hasn't been thinking about hating herself as much.
He wondered why someone would think that he was awesome.
He feels inadequate sometimes and is just feeling awful.
He states "part of me dies because it's hard to have to keep the fight and not kill myself"
He doesn't know why he keeps going in spite of how excruciating it is
She told one of the priests at her church that she was doing really badly and asked her to pray for her and she said she would
He caan't decide whether it be better to go to work tomorrow or not to go to work tomorrow.
He feels like he could take a nap right now and feels sorry about it
